title: Media Liaison Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Human Rights Foundation (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Was a lengthy process that spanned about 3 months. It was 4 rounds with different people in different executive positions, including a last round interview with the founder. There was also an assignment.
Interview Questions: Why HRF? Tell me about a time you navigated a difficult situation and conflict?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Human Rights Foundation
Interview Descriptions: Overall it was really nice and the organization seemed very welcoming. I liked my interviewer and there was open communication.I first heard back about a first round interview, and then moved onto the second round, both on Zoom.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in human rights?

title: Oslo Freedom Forum Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Human Rights Foundation (New York, NY) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with a policy officer, Q & A format, interviewer was friendly and welcoming. Next step in interview process was a writing assignment that had to do with political philosophy and democratic values
Interview Questions: What is your ideal work environment?

title: Strategy Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Human Rights Foundation (New York, NY) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Questions were straightforward. I was interviewed primarily by the organization's president, with a couple of other employees for brief periods. Interview process also included completing and discussing Caliper test to assess professional strengths and weaknesses.
Interview Questions: How do you handle challenging situations

title: Development Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Human Rights Foundation
Interview Descriptions: Pretty quick response from the foundation. Interviewer was really nice and the entire interview process was pretty informal. Not too many questions but one topic led to another and ended up talking about skills, interest in human rights and experiences.

title: Legal Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Human Rights Foundation (New York, NY) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: the interview was short covering the basics of my background. the interviewer talked about what the organization did from a broad perspective. The questions were not hard. The interviewer was friendly.
Interview Questions: do you have a real interest in human rights?
